description: Largest prime factor of n-th Fibonacci number.
comments: For n > 12, Fibonacci(n) is divisible by a primitive prime factor (one not dividing Fibonacci(1), ..., Fibonacci(n-1)). But all primes up to n-2 divide smaller Fibonacci numbers, see A001602, so a(n) >= n-1 for n > 12. This strengthens a more general theorem of Bravo and Luca. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 01 2013
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..1000
U. Alfred, On the form of primitive factors of Fibonacci numbers, Fibonacci Quarterly 1:1 (1963), pp. 43-45.
Jhon J. Bravo and Florian Luca, On the largest prime factor of the k-Fibonacci numbers, 2012.
D. E. Daykin and L. A. G. Dresel, Factorization of Fibonacci numbers, Fibonacci Quarterly 8:1 (1970), pp. 23-30.
formula: a(n) >= n - 1 for n > 12, see comments. It is not hard to show that a(n) > 1000 for n > 88. Similarly a(n) > 20641 for n > 120. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 01 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 03 2001
